channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10412] Distributed log replay : Cell tags getting missed
item.description: This is caused by HBASE-10322. The default RPC codec KVCodec strips tags.
item.summary: Distributed log replay : Cell tags getting missed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Again this can be solved by setting hbase.client.rpc.codec at the HRS to some codec which consider tags also. (KeyValueCodecWithTags or CellCodecWithTags). With this way, the issue can be solved by a doc update.

For replication we have introduced a new config to specify a replication specific codec name. Might not be good to add a new config to specify a replay codec.
Distributed log replay should be using WALCellCodec to read and write tags? Right?

The HRS which reads WAL uses this codec. But that HRS will be calling HRS#replay() for the WALEdits and use codec to ship cells to destination RS. At this time the KVCodec is getting used and this strip tags.

Ok, may be the new way of log replay. got it. So this will need codec change. May be can we make this by default WALCellCodec only? anyway internally WALCellcodec and keyvaluecodec are the same execpt that after HBASe-10322 walcellcodec writes tags too?
Comments clashed.

May be can we make this by default WALCellCodec only?

Looks Fine for me. Jeffrey Zhong, Ted Yu , stack what do you guys think?

We can set the Codec, to be used by WAL, using hbase.regionserver.wal.codec
Phoenix is having custom WALCellCodec implementation for index.(WALEditCodec it is as we have that name in 0.94) For the distributed log replay from one RS to another RS, the same custom WALCellCodec should get used?
Ping Jesse Yates, Lars Hofhansl

We should fix this so we are not using a RPC codec for handling a WAL. That is surprising and wrong.

We can set the Codec, to be used by WAL, using hbase.regionserver.wal.codec

Phoenix is having custom WALCellCodec implementation for index.(WALEditCodec it is as we have that name in 0.94) For the distributed log replay from one RS to another RS, the same custom WALCellCodec should get used

+1, something like this
Also, we should have a unit test to cover this.

We planned to enable distributed log splitting for the existing TestvisibilityLabels itself. That would ensure that it works at the same time we could solve the issue by using the wal.codec config. Ideally for all WAL related codecs including writing to HLog we could use this config. Using the same codec for all wal related operations ideally seems right to me.

We planned to enable distributed log splitting for the existing TestvisibilityLabels itself. That would ensure that it works at the same time we could solve the issue by using the wal.codec config. Ideally for all WAL related codecs including writing to HLog we could use this config. Using the same codec for all wal related operations ideally seems right to me.

+1

Patch looks good to me.

On this part:

@@ -169,22 +168,25 @@ public class HLogSplitter {

 

   HLogSplitter(Configuration conf, Path rootDir,

       FileSystem fs, LastSequenceId idChecker, ZooKeeperWatcher zkw) {

-    this.conf = conf;

+    this.conf = HBaseConfiguration.create(conf);

+    String codecClassName = conf

+        .get(WALCellCodec.WAL_CELL_CODEC_CLASS_KEY, WALCellCodec.class.getName());

+    this.conf.set(HConstants.RPC_CODEC_CONF_KEY, codecClassName);

Here we are telling HLogSplitter to use a WAL codec for RPC. Makes sense but could be a future source of surprise. We should update the javadoc of WALCellCodec to let people know this is used not only server side but also for sending edits as part of the distributed splitting process.

+    conf.setBoolean(HConstants.DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY, true);

Should the test be parameterized so that both log splitting and log replay are covered ?

As Andy said:

We should fix this so we are not using a RPC codec for handling a WAL. That is surprising and wrong.

Should be ok for now to just update javadoc, but I'm worried we'll start rolling in custom behavior for RPC that makes it very complicated.

As Andy said:

We should fix this so we are not using a RPC codec for handling a WAL. That is surprising and wrong.

Should be ok for now to just update javadoc, but I'm worried we'll start rolling in custom behavior for RPC that makes it very complicated.

I agree.

Looks like we are splitting this into two parts.

1. Get distributed log replay working with tags using a WALCodec. (Now)

2. Redo distributed replay a bit so it doesn't use a bare codec but uses its own. Maybe a RPC codec as static inner class that embeds a WAL codec? (Later)

Jesse Yates in case of Phoenix, I think you will need the custom WALCellCodec to do the RS->RS write. Then only it will come as IndexedKeyValue object right? Pls correct me if I am wrong.

Yes I will update the javadoc of WALCellCodec

Ted Yu Need to set conf.setBoolean(HConstants.DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY, distributedLogReplay); in setupBeforeClass for starting the cluster. So I can not go with parameterized way.

Jesse Yates in case of Phoenix, I think you will need the custom WALCellCodec to do the RS->RS write. Then only it will come as IndexedKeyValue object right? Pls correct me if I am wrong.

No, it needs the custom WALCellCodec to read custom kvs from the WAL. The KVs can then be written normally as regular updates RS->Rs

1. Get distributed log replay working with tags using a WALCodec. (Now)

2. Redo distributed replay a bit so it doesn't use a bare codec but uses its own. Maybe a RPC codec as static inner class that embeds a WAL codec? (Later)

I can live with that... on you Mr. Release Manager to make it happen

I can live with that... on you Mr. Release Manager to make it happen

Wait. #2 not for 0.98.0.

Wait. #2 not for 0.98.0.

That's fine, but soon in the 98 series?

That's fine, but soon in the 98 series?

See HBASE-10414 for 0.98.1.
Patch addressing comments from Andy and Ted.
+1 to have the simple and best soln for 0.98.0

+public class TestVisibilityLabelsWithDistributedLogReplay extends TestVisibilityLabels {

+

+  @BeforeClass

+  public static void setupBeforeClass() throws Exception {

+    // setup configuration

+    conf = TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration();

+    conf.setBoolean(HConstants.DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY, true);

nit: if setting DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY is the only change from base test, consider reusing TestVisibilityLabels#setupBeforeClass()
Tests should not reuse setup from other tests. That seems to be a basic encapsulation violation.

This version avoids some duplication in setupBeforeClass.
Have to set
conf.setBoolean(HConstants.DISTRIBUTED_LOG_REPLAY_KEY, true);
before starting cluster.

V3 avoids some duplication in test class.

Tests should not reuse setup from other tests. That seems to be a basic encapsulation violation.

Got your point. Can ignore V3 version of patch then.

The patch looks good to me! We can combine WALEdit shipment in replay and replication WALEdits shipment to use the same code later.

Could we in the future to define a tag's visibility scope so that GET/Scan code path can automatically strip out tags when returns to external clients?

Thanks.

Got your point. Can ignore V3 version of patch then.

Ok, I need to delete it so HadoopQA will pick up V2.

Could we in the future to define a tag's visibility scope so that GET/Scan code path can automatically strip out tags when returns to external clients

We had some discussion about this on HBASE-10322. The short version is per-cell checks introduce performance concerns. That issue has a lot more verbiage.

With regard to replication, tag scope on a cell shares the same scope as the cell itself.
Looks like HadoopQA may be on vacation. Let me test this locally. I will commit if good.
Local tests are good. Committed to trunk and 0.98.
